alert.note: Alert for Prentiss (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 6:58PM CDT until April 13 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Mississippi and northeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in North Mississippi, Alcorn, Benton, Lafayette, Marshall, Panola, Prentiss and Tippah. In northeast Mississippi, Union. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 658 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Corinth, Booneville, New Albany, Holly Springs, Ripley, Wall Doxey State Park, John W Kyle State Park, Lamar, Blue Mountain, Ecru, Jumpertown, Glen, Snow Lake Shores, Gravestown, Keownville, Etta, Bethlehem, Canaan, Pinedale and New Harmony. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
